member_organisations: We are not a membership organisation
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Culture, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Youth, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Borders and Security, European Neighbourhood Policy
eu_initiatives: We follow a range of EU issues covering in particular the Brexit negotiations, the Future of EU, including democratic, institutional, and economic issues, the EU's neighbourhood and role in the world, migration and refugee issues, climate change and others
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
relevant_communication: Publishing regular comment pieces and policy notes, holding events, mainly in Scotland
goals__remit: The Scottish Centre on European Relations (SCER) is a new independent and unaligned EU think tank, based in Edinburgh, that aims to inform, debate and provide up-to-the-minute, high-quality research and analysis of European Union developments and challenges, with a particular focus on Scotland’s EU interests and policies.
